title: Women forced to discuss sensitive DV cases in public at ‘unsafe’ outback court | ABC NEWS
description: Each year, hundreds of domestic violence survivors turn to a regional courthouse in the Northern Territory town of Katherine.  But a coalition of women's legal services and the National Domestic, Family and Sexual Violence Commissioner warn the court could be putting women at further risk. Lillian Rangiah has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Kevin Rudd resigns a year early as Australia's ambassador to the US | ABC NEWS
description: Australia's ambassador to the United States, Kevin Rudd, will leave his posting one year ahead of schedule. He will vacate the role at the end of March with the prime minister now searching for a replacement. title: New details on Labor's sweeping hate speech and gun laws unveiled | ABC NEWS
description: Details of the government's hate speech and gun laws have been revealed, making it an offence to publicly incite racial hatred. In anticipation of the reforms passing, one neo-Nazi group has already said it will disband to avoid arrest. title: Woman behind crepe attack on chief minister sentenced in NT court | ABC NEWS
description: The woman who assaulted the Northern Territory's former chief minister with a cream crepe in 2023 has avoided jail time after receiving a suspended sentence today.  The former real-estate agent was found guilty of aggravated assault for pushing the crepe into Natasha Fyles' face, claiming she was motivated by anger over the government's COVID-19 vaccine rules. Court reporter Olivana Lathouris has this story for ABC News Northern Territory. title: More than 500 structures lost as Victoria continues to reel from devastating bushfires  | ABC NEWS
description: As fire warnings are downgraded across Victoria, farmers in the worst hit areas are picking up the pieces.  Almost 500 structures have been lost or damaged across the state and as the recovery efforts begin, some frustrations are setting in. title: At least 600 killed in Iran protest crackdown as Trump threatens action | ABC NEWS
description: Iran has warned the US it stands ready for war as it escalates its bloody crackdown on anti-regime protesters. The death toll has now risen to at least 600 and thousands more have been detained. US President Donald Trump has announced hefty tariffs in response, and the White House says strikes are still on the table. title: Relatives of Bondi attack victims plead for revised compensation scheme | ABC NEWS
description: Some victims of the Bondi terror attack and their families are calling for the federal government to arrange a new compensation scheme for those affected. They say the existing scheme is cumbersome and doesn't match the magnitude of the community's pain. The prime minister has announced a national day of mourning for the victims on January 22, while work is underway to preserve the thousands of floral tributes collected from Bondi Pavilion to create a permanent memorial. title: NT rejects national gun buyback scheme over co-funding proposal | ABC NEWS
description: Territory gun owners have voiced their support for the CLP government's rejection of a national gun buyback.  It comes as the federal government prepares legislation to create the scheme, which would partly be paid for by the states and territories. Jack Hislop has this report for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Crowds tear-gassed and lawsuit filed over Minneapolis ICE crackdown | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Thousands of federal agents have descended on Minnesota and Illinois, prompting both states to sue Donald Trump's government to end the crackdown. Meanwhile around the country, protesters have clashed with officers attempting to make more arrests. Angus Mackintosh reports for The World.
